title: Keyword Research For Low Content Books For KDP  - Are your keywords indexed?

tactics.name: Keyword Indexing Check
tactics.description: Verify if Amazon has indexed specific keywords for a book by using ISBN numbers to search for keyword rankings.
steps: Copy ISBN 10 number from the book
Paste ISBN into Amazon search bar with target keyword
Check if book appears in results
caveats: Does not show ranking position, only indexing status
source_quotes: we copy paste the asin number or the isbn 10 number into the search bar and then you type in a keyword that you want to check

tactics.name: keyword indexing check
tactics.description: Verify if keywords are indexed by Amazon's algorithm
caveats: Does not account for Google indexing
source_quotes: Amazon doesn't index your description it only indexes the keywords as in the title the subtitle and the back end keywords

heuristics.name: Review-Driven Visibility
heuristics.condition: If a book has low review count, it may have limited keyword visibility
source_quotes: the ranking depends on a lot of things like for example sales of your book if your book has made a few sales it will rank a little bit higher

heuristics.name: description seo priority
source_quotes: the description is just as important as the other places where you can put in your keywords

claims.statement: Amazon indexes keywords as single words, not phrases
source_quotes: amazon will just take the keywords as single words

claims.statement: Amazon does not index book descriptions but does index keywords in title, subtitle, and backend
source_quotes: Amazon doesn't index your description it only indexes the keywords as in the title the subtitle and the back end keywords

niche_patterns.description: Target underserved niches with specific content constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: High search volume with low competition for niche keywords
source_quotes: this is a book that we can easily produce ourselves but it's been so successful
